runs.comm: short of a length outside off, pulled straight to mid-on
banged in short again, this time Finch goes squarer with his pull, gets it over midwicket without perfectly timing it...comes off more top edge than middle
fuller, on middle and off, straightens a touch on Finch and squares him up...the ball squirts into the off side
fantastic bowling! That's a textbook yorker, lock the replay of that one away for your career, Kagiso. Dead-eye accurate on middle and off, squeezes under the toe end of Finch's bat. Done for pace.
now he's back to the short ball, Smith pulls it behind square
full at off stump, Watson comes onto the front foot and defends
full outside off, hint of shape away from Smith who allows himself the luxury of a leave
fairly similar delivery, just a touch shorter outside off, Smith goes across the crease and pulls it through straight midwicket off the front foot
just short of midwicket! Another delivery banged in, Smith on the pull and he's beaten for pace, the ball comes off the handle and glove. Some pain for Smith
fuller outside off, a wild swing with his feet planted on leg stump...pretty much a slog
full and wide outside off, a much more controlled stroke this time as he drives it through the covers...not a million miles from the fielder, but placed well enough
width outside off, 147kph, Smith swings at it and gets a bottom edge wide of the stumps...smart piece of fielding from de Kock who collects and hits direct at the non-striker's end, but Smith is safe
shuffles across the crease and flips a length delivery from outside off backward of square on the leg side
angled into middle and leg, Watson doesn't make contact and it takes the pad to the leg side
pushed onto the pads and flicked to long leg
very short outside off, 146kph, and climbs over Smith's top edge as he has another wild swipe

too quick for Smith, short outside off, and he tries to somehow get this to the leg side again and ends up with a thick outside edge down to third man with one hand off the bat. This isn't pretty from Smith
full and straight, 145kph, Watson opens his stance a touch and crunches it straight to mid-off
starts with a straight delivery which Smith aims into the leg side, the ball trickles to square leg
short of a length outside off, 134kph, cut firmly into the ground and it bounces to point...Watson will feel that was a boundary ball
he moves to the leg side against this shorter delivery and pulls to midwicket inside the circle
fuller, this follows Watson as he moves outside leg, 133kph, and thunders into the pads
connects well enough this time to beat mid-on, short outside off stump and Watson fetches it with the pull...still not ideally timed, but it's wide of the diving mid-on and beats deep midwicket

moving outside leg stump again, Steyn follows him and it comes out as a full toss...Watson jabs it, rather alarmed, into the off side. Questions whether it should have been a no-ball. Looked just okay.

appeal for a catch down the leg side, but it's called a wide...Smith moving around his crease, goes to help this off his hip. There was a noise and the ball wasn't near the pad. The replay suggests it was glove
pushed into the off side
gets this one cleanly, it was a fuller ball and Smith was able to get underneath it with a (relatively) straight bat and lofts it over mid-on
back of a length, crunched towards square leg with another cross-batted swat...square leg can't stop it cleanly, Steyn tidies up in the deep
swing and a miss as he moves outside leg stump then swings to the on side, the ball scoots past his inside edge and pads
much fuller, on middle and leg, takes a thick outside edge into the covers as he aims into midwicket
a bouncer, angled over leg stump, travels over the gloves and he escapes a wide call

oh, my goodness! What a catch by Rabada at third man. This is stunning and will take be a moment to explain. It was a short-of-a-length delivery outside off, Smith throws the kitchen sink at it and a top edge flies towards third man. Rabada started by running in and actually came too far. He realised, then just thrust up his right hand above his head and the ball stuck. Then, it was able to keep hold as he tumbled to the crowd. A mind-boggling grab
beaten and tries to play this delivery into the off side, just a hint of swing
width outside off, he goes for the upper cut and gets it wide of third man (even KG isn't reaching it)

another terrific catch! They are holding everything at the moment. Duminy running back from point this time. Short outside off, Watson having another full-blown swing at it. The ball doesn't have the distance this time, but Duminy still did superbly to take it over his shoulder. Would also have had Rabada in the corner of his hand coming from third man
lovely bowling...full outside off, Warner's feet not quite moving yet, the ball shapes in a touch the holds its line to beat the drive
short of a length on the hip and he gets it away fine with a neat tuck past short fine leg
shoved down the leg side, called wide
angled down to third man from outside off
short of a length, Warner pulls to deep square leg
tucks a length delivery gently into square leg...Australia just trying to settle for a few moments
this time there's more power and he has the placement, short from Morris and it sits up for the pull which is well controlled backward of square
gets the line outside off, still short of a length, chopped to backward point
slower ball, full outside off, driven into the covers
full at off stump, opens the face and drives to deep point
nicely played, moving across to off stump and whips a straight delivery off his pads wide of short fine leg
back outside off stump, Maxwell drives and it comes off the toe of the bat towards third man
slashes again at some width outside off, Morris gets more work at third man and can't stop the second
top shot! The best of Maxwell. Holds his shape and drives on the up through the line of a length delivery outside off and sends it over long off
good response from Wiese as he gets this one past Maxwell's outside edge as he drives
tucks a straight delivery into midwicket
goes for the reverse sweep to a straight full toss and gets it fine of short third man
on off stump, tight line, pushed to cover
worked into the leg side
that's pumped over deep midwicket...fetched from full outside off, down on his back knee, with the slog sweep. Good connection
cut to deep cover
back of a length, driven to deep cover
that slips out as a big full toss, gets heaved to deep square where there's bad misfield by Tahir which gifts a boundary...didn't quite anticipate the spin on the ball
heaves a length delivery through straight midwicket, a skimming shot from Maxwell which bisects deep midwicket and long on
another low full toss, straighter this time, swung to long on
short outside off and handsomely put away over deep midwicket with a strong-armed pull...a dragged down slower ball, so basically a long hop
drives a full delivery into the covers
flayed over the off side, a hint of width to Warner who throws his hands through the drive and sends it over cover
touch shorter this time, Warner angry with himself as he finds cover inside the circle
comes forward and drives to the cover sweeper
flicks a straight delivery through midwicket
can't get this one away, nudges into the leg side
stays back in the crease and flicks it carefully into midwicket
full outside off, on the popping crease, squeezed to backward point
low full toss outside off, driven to cover
full and straight, another low full toss, flicked through midwicket, good work in the deep...Wiese now trying to keep the ball full
some width outside off which is driven to long off
tries to reverse sweep a wide delivery outside off, defeated by the slower delivery
so he opts for something more conventional and it's more productive...pumps a full delivery straight down the ground. Stand and deliver.
short outside off, Warner onto the back foot and drags it to deep midwicket
he saw Maxwell starting to move and fired this down the leg side
nearly cleans him up with a short ball which scoots through a touch low and defeats Maxwell's pull
flicked to deep midwicket
full outside off, Warner aiming to deep midwicket with a slog sweep but gets an inside edge into his back leg
that's just brute force, hammers it straight down the ground...wasn't quite so full, and it didn't even come out of the middle but comfortably split the deep fielders
this flies off the top edge as he swings across the line and goes fine of short third man
and he gets launched into the stands over long on...Maxwell swings at a full delivery, a slower ball, outside off and even though it comes off close to the bottom of the bat it has the legs
that's just a little bit bonkers, but then it's Maxwell after all...reverse ramp or scoop at a low full toss which he gets almost over the keeper's head
goes for another reverse hit and this time doesn't make contact
that's a big full and it's out of the ground! Swung over deep square leg. Horrid delivery, really. And that's his fifty off 26 deliveries
comes round the wicket, pushed across wide outside off and he doesn't get away with that
that's better, a yorker just outside off, jabbed into the off side...a mundane single
back over he wicket, Warner swings himself off his feet as he tries to catch up with a delivery angled wide across him...not far from a wide, but the umpire lets it go
cut firmly into the covers, straight to du Plessis but still a single which brings up the hundred stand off 44 balls
full toss. Dispatched. Slog sweep. Deep midwicket. Rinse and repeat
that's brilliant from Warner, this ball pitches quite wide outside off but he's able to drag it straight of long on...skims over the outfield. That's his fifty
over deep midwicket again! There were cries of 'catch it' and it didn't have huge elevation, but just had the height to beat Morris near the rope
down on his back knee with another slog sweep and this time it's straight to deep midwicket
a moment of relative calm as he tucks a single through midwicket
length ball outside off, opens the face and dabbed into the covers
it doesn't matter who you are, you are being launched into the stands...this is short of a length and Warner plays a terrific pick-up pull over deep square leg
that comes out as a low full toss, Warner swings hard, his bottom hand comes off the bat as he finds long on
crunched into the off side, can't beat the circle
well bowled, but Warner is still able to dig it out straight down the ground, was full at leg stump
beats him outside off, the ball scoots past the outside edge as Maxwell drives...a precious dot ball
round the wicket, full outside off, swung to deep midwicket
that's well bowled, full at off stump, squirted into the off side
charges down the pitch, it was already a full toss, that's crunched straight down the ground...at the boundary almost before you can blink
responds well with a yorker at middle stump, takes an inside into his boot...can't get the single
whipped strongly along the ground through midwicket
and it's a filthy full toss, Maxwell swings with his full force and it takes a top edge to third man...and it's a no-ball! Oh dear.
full, angled down the leg side, it's a wide so the free hit carries over...and the over has gone very pear-shaped
now it's wide outside off! Maxwell moving around his crease, Morris trying to out think him but it's too wide
manages to get this full and straight, was still a free hit, clubbed towards long-on and the pace of this pair between the wickets makes it into a brace
full, straight, hint of swing...Warner misses his whip to the leg side and the ball cannons off his pads to the covers
backs away to leg against a length delivery, driven through mid-off where du Plessis dives and gets a hand on it...comes up holding his shoulder
another big full toss, sliced away off a thick outer part of the bat down to third man
full outside off, driven straight to point. They scamper the run and there's no throw due to a lack of backing up
another full toss, and just over cover! Warner slicing his drive, du Plessis leapt at cover on the edge of the circle
he just can't pitch it at the moment, that's a big full toss and called a no-ball this time...swung into the on side
tries to be inventive, effectively sweeps a delivery from full outside off along the ground through midwicket and more excellent running from this pair
short of a length, swing and a miss! Dot ball
full, angled into the pads, he doesn't make contact and it's just a leg bye towards midwicket. The tension mounts
comes round the wicket, aiming full at the stumps, Warner smears it straight to long on
oh, Maxwell! We've seen it so many times, but it's still brilliant. Under pressure he was reverse swept a full delivery outside off fine of short third man
and he's gone! Doesn't connect cleanly as he swings at a length delivery, skews off the face of the bat and reaches deep cover

it's all happening! It's well bowled, speared in at the pads, deflects straight back Morris but Warner just wants the strike. Marsh had no chance, but Morris then under-arms the ball wide of the stumps from about six yards away! Don't take him ten-pin bowling tonight
got him! That man Rabada does it again! Full, straight, Warner swinging across the line and misses. The Wanderers crowd goes wild. Actually took Warner's back leg and deflected into the stumps
wide outside off, and called wide! Rabada trying to keep it full but gets the line wrong
gets a length delivery and launches it straight down the ground, long on comes around and then flicks the ball to long off to throw in
swing and a miss! Called wide again! That seems a harsh call. Looked inside the white guideline to me. Actually, on the replay, that was over the white guideline, so fair call from the umpire
gets this full and straight, driven through the covers to the sweeper and they can't cut off the second...wasn't a very good return from the deep

it's a good ball, full at the stumps, but he gets it straight down the ground...bisects long on and long off, then the return from the deep has very little power on the throw. Marsh was struggling to make his ground, the ball took an age to get back from the deep. Goes to the third umpire but he's just safe. A costly weak throw
swings to leg against a length ball, gets an inside edge into his pads and it runs into the off side

he bunts it straight down the ground and Australia win! It was a good delivery, full and straight, but Marsh managed to hit it into the pitch, past Rababa and neither long off or long on could stop the second.
